description.narrative: Output 1.4: By 2018, all levels of the health system, community structures and local authorities have strengthened capacities in planning and monitoring in accordance with equity- and gender-based approaches, in supply management (including supplies aimed at the prevention, detection and case management of HIV) and in logistics

sector.narrative: HSS - Health sector policy, planning and governance at national or sub-national levels
HSS - Health systems procurement and supplies management
Immunization supply chain, including cold chain
Technical assistance - Maternal and newborn health

title.narrative: Niger United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Niger Country Programme Document 2014-2018 Results Matrix
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2018 Niger: Evaluation des cliniques mobiles dans la région de Diffa
Niger 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Niger Country Office 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 1.4: By 2018, all levels of the health system, community structures and local authorities have strengthened capacities in planning and monitoring in accordance with equity- and gender-based approaches, in supply management (including supplies aimed at the prevention, detection and case management of HIV) and in logistics

description.narrative: In 2018, emphasis on Health System Strengthening (HSS) was sustained and action was increasingly operationalized to address bottlenecks in priority target areas including scaling up high-impact interventions, Health Sector coordination, equity-focused Health Financing, Procurement and Supply Management (PSM), and Health Information Systems. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/01/2019

title.narrative: Number of health districts with convergence municipalities with at least 30% of their micro-plans funded, having improved their performance from one monitoring to the next
% of districts in convergence municipalities having an operational and functional cold-chain and oxygen concentrator maintenance/repair system
% of health districts in convergence municipalities that submit their Notifiable Diseases report timely and with 100% completeness
Relevant essential commodities registered with the relevant regulation authority and guidelines for use in facilities available
The supply system for Essential Medicines and other health commodities optimised (2017-18)
An analysis of the Essential Medicines and other health commodities supply system conducted at national level (2016)
An analysis of sex-disaggregated infant and child mortality estimates is produced
HMIS generates annual reports of health facility and HRH distribution according to national guidelines
Health Management Information System generates periodic reports with data disaggregated by age and sex (for relevant indicators) at national and sub-national level
